statsd.description: The tag style configurations to send metrics with [tags](https://github.com/prometheus/statsd_exporter#tagging-extensions). Defaults to `nil`, which doesn't add any tags to the metrics. Allowed values are  `dogstatsd`, `influxdb`, `librato`, and `signalfx`.

syslog.name: successful_severity
syslog.description:
An optional logging severity assigned to all the successful requests with a response
status code less then 400. Available options: `debug`, `info`, `notice`, `warning`, `err`, `crit`, `alert`, `emerg`.

syslog.name: client_errors_severity
syslog.description:
An optional logging severity assigned to all the failed requests with a
response status code 400 or higher but less than 500. Available options: `debug`, `info`, `notice`,
`warning`, `err`, `crit`, `alert`, `emerg`.

syslog.name: server_errors_severity
syslog.description:
An optional logging severity assigned to all the failed requests with a
response status code 500 or higher. Available options: `debug`, `info`, `notice`, `warning`, `err`, `crit`, `alert`, `emerg`.

syslog.name: log_level
syslog.description:
An optional logging severity. Any request with equal or higher severity
will be logged to System log. Available options: `debug`, `info`, `notice`, `warning`, `err`, `crit`, `alert`, `emerg`.

syslog.name: custom_fields_by_lua
syslog.description:
A list of key-value pairs, where the key is the name of a log field and
the value is a chunk of Lua code, whose return value sets or replaces
the log field value.

syslog.name: facility
syslog.description:
The facility is used by the operating system to decide how to handle each log message. This
optional argument defines what must be the facility set by the plugin when logging. Available
options: `auth`, `authpriv`, `cron`, `daemon`, `ftp`, `kern`, `lpr`, `mail`, `news`, `syslog`,
`user`, `uucp`, `local0`, `local1`, `local2`, `local3`, `local4`, `local5`, `local6`, `local7`.

tcp-log.name: host
tcp-log.description: The IP address or host name to send data to.

tcp-log.name: port
tcp-log.description: The port to send data to on the upstream server.

tcp-log.name: timeout
tcp-log.description: An optional timeout in milliseconds when sending data to the upstream server.

tcp-log.name: keepalive
tcp-log.description: An optional value in milliseconds that defines how long an idle connection lives before being closed.

tcp-log.name: tls
tcp-log.description: Indicates whether to perform a TLS handshake against the remote server.

tcp-log.name: tls_sni
tcp-log.description: An optional string that defines the SNI (Server Name Indication) hostname to send in the TLS handshake.

tcp-log.name: custom_fields_by_lua
tcp-log.description:
A list of key-value pairs, where the key is the name of a log field and
the value is a chunk of Lua code, whose return value sets or replaces
the log field value.

tls-handshake-modifier.name: tls_client_certificate
tls-handshake-modifier.description:
Indicates the TLS handshake preference. The only option is `REQUEST`, which
requests the client certificate.

tls-metadata-headers.name: inject_client_cert_details
tls-metadata-headers.description: Enables TLS client certificate metadata values to be injected into HTTP headers.

tls-metadata-headers.name: client_cert_header_name
tls-metadata-headers.description: Define the HTTP header name used for the PEM format URL encoded client certificate.

tls-metadata-headers.name: client_serial_header_name
tls-metadata-headers.description: Define the HTTP header name used for the serial number of the client certificate.

tls-metadata-headers.name: client_cert_issuer_dn_header_name
tls-metadata-headers.description: Define the HTTP header name used for the issuer DN of the client certificate.

tls-metadata-headers.name: client_cert_subject_dn_header_name
tls-metadata-headers.description: Define the HTTP header name used for the subject DN of the client certificate.

tls-metadata-headers.name: client_cert_fingerprint_header_name
tls-metadata-headers.description: Define the HTTP header name used for the SHA1 fingerprint of the client certificate.

udp-log.name: host
udp-log.description: The IP address or host name to send data to.

udp-log.name: port
udp-log.description: The port to send data to on the upstream server.

udp-log.name: timeout
udp-log.description: An optional timeout in milliseconds when sending data to the upstream server.

udp-log.name: custom_fields_by_lua
udp-log.description:
A list of key-value pairs, where the key is the name of a log field and
the value is a chunk of Lua code, whose return value sets or replaces
the log field value.

upstream-timeout.name: connect_timeout
upstream-timeout.description:
The timeout, in milliseconds, for establishing a connection to the upstream server.
Overrides the service object [`connect_timeout`](/gateway/latest/how-kong-works/routing-traffic/#proxying-and-upstream-timeouts) setting, if the setting exists.

upstream-timeout.name: send_timeout
upstream-timeout.description:
The timeout, in milliseconds, between two
successive write operations when sending a request to the upstream server.
Overrides the service object [`write_timeout`](/gateway/latest/how-kong-works/routing-traffic/#proxying-and-upstream-timeouts) setting, if the setting exists.

upstream-timeout.name: read_timeout
upstream-timeout.description:
The timeout, in milliseconds, between two
successive read operations when receiving a response from the upstream server.
Overrides the service object [`read_timeout`](/gateway/latest/how-kong-works/routing-traffic/#proxying-and-upstream-timeouts) setting, if the setting exists.

vault-auth.name: access_token_name
vault-auth.description: Describes an array of comma-separated parameter names where the plugin looks for an access token. The client must send the access token in one of those key names, and the plugin will try to read the credential from a header or the querystring parameter with the same name. The key names can only contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], [_], and [-].

vault-auth.name: vault.id
vault-auth.description: A reference to an existing `vault` object within the database. `vault` entities define the connection and authentication parameters used to connect to a Vault HTTP(S) API.

vault-auth.name: secret_token_name
vault-auth.description: Describes an array of comma-separated parameter names where the plugin looks for a secret token. The client must send the secret in one of those key names, and the plugin will try to read the credential from a header or the querystring parameter with the same name. The key names can only contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], [_], and [-].

vault-auth.name: tokens_in_body
vault-auth.description: If enabled, the plugin will read the request body (if said request has one and its MIME type is supported) and try to find the key in it. Supported MIME types are `application/www-form-urlencoded`, `application/json`, and `multipart/form-data`.

vault-auth.name: hide_credentials
vault-auth.description: An optional boolean value telling the plugin to show or hide the credential from the upstream service. If `true`, the plugin will strip the credential from the request (i.e. the header or querystring containing the key) before proxying it.

vault-auth.name: anonymous
vault-auth.description: An optional string (consumer UUID or username) value to use as an “anonymous” consumer if authentication fails. If empty (default null), the request fails with an authentication failure `4xx`. Note that this value must refer to the consumer `id` or `username` attribute, and **not** its `custom_id`.

vault-auth.name: anonymous
vault-auth.description:
An optional string (consumer UUID) value to use as an anonymous consumer if authentication fails.
If empty (default), the request fails with an authentication failure `4xx`. Note that this value
must refer to the consumer `id` attribute that is internal to Kong Gateway, and **not** its `custom_id`.

vault-auth.name: run_on_preflight
vault-auth.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the plugin should run (and try to authenticate) on `OPTIONS` preflight requests. If set to `false`, then `OPTIONS` requests will always be allowed.

websocket-size-limit.name: client_max_payload
websocket-size-limit.description:
Maximum size (in bytes) of client-originated WebSocket messages. Must
be greater than `0` and less than `33554432` (32 MiB)

websocket-size-limit.name: upstream_max_payload
websocket-size-limit.description:
Maximum size (in bytes) of upstream-originated WebSocket messages. Must
be greater than `0` and less than `33554432` (32 MiB)

websocket-validator.name: client.text.schema
websocket-validator.description:
Schema used to validate client-originated text frames. The semantics of
this field depend on the validation type set by `config.client.text.type`.

websocket-validator.name: client.text.type
websocket-validator.description:
The corresponding validation library for `config.client.text.schema`.
Currently, only `draft4` is supported.

websocket-validator.name: client.binary.schema
websocket-validator.description:
Schema used to validate client-originated binary frames. The semantics of
this field depend on the validation type set by `config.client.binary.type`.

websocket-validator.name: client.binary.type
websocket-validator.description:
The corresponding validation library for `config.client.binary.schema`.
Currently, only `draft4` is supported.

websocket-validator.name: upstream.text.schema
websocket-validator.description:
Schema used to validate upstream-originated text frames. The semantics of
this field depend on the validation type set by `config.upstream.text.type`.

websocket-validator.name: upstream.text.type
websocket-validator.description:
The corresponding validation library for `config.upstream.text.schema`.
Currently, only `draft4` is supported.

websocket-validator.name: upstream.binary.schema
websocket-validator.description:
Schema used to validate upstream-originated binary frames. The semantics of
this field depend on the validation type set by `config.upstream.binary.type`.

websocket-validator.name: upstream.binary.type
websocket-validator.description:
The corresponding validation library for `config.upstream.binary.schema`.
Currently, only `draft4` is supported.

xml-threat-protection.name: checked_content_types
xml-threat-protection.description: A list of Content-Type values with payloads that must be validated.

xml-threat-protection.name: allowed_content_types
xml-threat-protection.description:
A list of Content-Type values with payloads that are allowed, but aren't validated.
For example, if the API also accepts JSON, you can add `"application/json"`.

xml-threat-protection.name: allow_dtd
xml-threat-protection.description: Indicates whether an XML Document Type Definition (DTD) section is allowed.

xml-threat-protection.name: namespace_aware
xml-threat-protection.description: If not parsing namespace aware, all prefixes and namespace attributes will be counted as regular attributes and element names, and validated as such.

xml-threat-protection.name: max_depth
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum depth of tags. Child elements such as Text or Comments are not counted as another level.

xml-threat-protection.name: max_children
xml-threat-protection.description:
Maximum number of children allowed (Element, Text, Comment, ProcessingInstruction, CDATASection).
Note: Adjacent text and CDATA sections are counted as one. For example, `text-cdata-text-cdata` is one child.

xml-threat-protection.name: max_attributes
xml-threat-protection.description:
Maximum number of attributes allowed on a tag, including default ones.
Note: If namespace-aware parsing is disabled, then the namespaces definitions are counted as attributes.

xml-threat-protection.name: max_namespaces
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum number of namespaces defined on a tag. This value is required if parsing is namespace-aware.

xml-threat-protection.name: document
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of the entire document.

xml-threat-protection.name: buffer
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of the unparsed buffer (see below).

xml-threat-protection.name: comment
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of comments.

xml-threat-protection.name: localname
xml-threat-protection.description:
Maximum size of the localname. This applies to tags and attributes.
Note: If parsing isn't namespace-aware, this limit counts against the full name (prefix + localname).

xml-threat-protection.name: prefix
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of the prefix. This applies to tags and attributes. This value is required if parsing is namespace-aware.

xml-threat-protection.name: namespaceuri
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of the namespace URI. This value is required if parsing is namespace-aware.

xml-threat-protection.name: attribute
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of the attribute value.

xml-threat-protection.name: text
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum text inside tags (counted over all adjacent text/CDATA elements combined).

xml-threat-protection.name: pitarget
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of processing instruction targets.

xml-threat-protection.name: pidata
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of processing instruction data.

xml-threat-protection.name: entityname
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of entity names in EntityDecl.

xml-threat-protection.name: entity
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of entity values in EntityDecl.

xml-threat-protection.name: entityproperty
xml-threat-protection.description: Maximum size of systemId, publicId, or notationName in EntityDecl.

xml-threat-protection.name: bla_max_amplification
xml-threat-protection.description: Sets the maximum allowed amplification. This protects against the Billion Laughs Attack.

xml-threat-protection.name: bla_threshold
xml-threat-protection.description: Sets the threshold after which the protection starts. This protects against the Billion Laughs Attack.

zipkin.name: local_service_name
zipkin.description:
The name of the service as displayed in Zipkin. Customize this name to
tell your Kong Gateway services apart in Zipkin request traces.

zipkin.name: http_endpoint
zipkin.description:
The full HTTP(S) endpoint to which Zipkin spans should be sent by Kong.
If not specified, the Zipkin plugin will only act as a tracing header
generator/transmitter.

zipkin.name: sample_ratio
zipkin.description:
How often to sample requests that do not contain trace IDs.
Set to `0` to turn sampling off, or to `1` to sample **all** requests. The
value must be between zero (0) and one (1), inclusive.

zipkin.name: default_service_name
zipkin.description:
Set a default service name to override `unknown-service-name` in the 
Zipkin spans.

zipkin.name: include_credential
zipkin.description:
Specify whether the credential of the currently authenticated consumer
should be included in metadata sent to the Zipkin server.

zipkin.name: traceid_byte_count
zipkin.description: The length in bytes of each request's Trace ID. The value can be either `8` or `16`.

zipkin.name: header_type
zipkin.description:
All HTTP requests going through the plugin are tagged with a tracing HTTP request.
This property codifies what kind of tracing header the plugin expects on incoming requests.

Possible values: `b3`, `b3-single`, `w3c`, `preserve`, `jaeger`, `ot`, or `ignore`.
* `b3`: Expects [Zipkin's B3 multiple headers](https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation#multiple-headers)
on incoming requests, and will add them to the transmitted requests if the headers are missing from those requests.
* `b3-single`: Expects or adds Zipkin's B3 single-header tracing headers.
* `w3c`: Expects or adds W3C's traceparent tracing header.
* `preserve`: Does not expect any format, and will transmit whatever header is recognized or present,
with a default of `b3` if none is found. In case of a mismatch between the expected and incoming
tracing headers (for example, when `header_type` is set to `b3` but a w3c-style tracing header is
found in the incoming request), then the plugin will add both kinds of tracing headers
to the request and generate a mismatch warning in the logs.

zipkin.name: header_type
zipkin.description:
All HTTP requests going through the plugin are tagged with a tracing HTTP request.
This property codifies what kind of tracing header the plugin expects on incoming requests.

Possible values: `b3`, `b3-single`, `w3c`, `preserve`, `jaeger`, `ot`, or `ignore`.
* `b3`: Expects [Zipkin's B3 multiple headers](https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation#multiple-headers)
on incoming requests, and will add them to the transmitted requests if the headers are missing from those requests.
* `b3-single`: Expects or adds Zipkin's B3 single-header tracing headers.
* `w3c`: Expects or adds W3C's traceparent tracing header.
* `preserve`: Does not expect any format, and will transmit whatever header is recognized or present,
with a default of `b3` if none is found. In case of a mismatch between the expected and incoming
tracing headers (for example, when `header_type` is set to `b3` but a w3c-style tracing header is
found in the incoming request), then the plugin will add both kinds of tracing headers
to the request and generate a mismatch warning in the logs.
* `jaeger`: Expects or adds
[Jaeger-style tracing headers](https://www.jaegertracing.io/docs/1.22/client-libraries/#propagation-format) (`uber-trace-id`).
* `ot`: Expects or adds [OpenTelemetry tracing headers](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/96e8523544f04c305da5382854eee06218599075/extensions/trace_propagators/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/extensions/trace/propagation/OtTracerPropagator.java) of the form `ot-tracer-*`.

zipkin.name: header_type
zipkin.description:
All HTTP requests going through the plugin are tagged with a tracing HTTP request.
This property codifies what kind of tracing header the plugin expects on incoming requests.

Possible values: `b3`, `b3-single`, `w3c`, `preserve`, `jaeger`, `ot`, or `ignore`.
* `b3`: Expects [Zipkin's B3 multiple headers](https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation#multiple-headers)
on incoming requests, and will add them to the transmitted requests if the headers are missing from those requests.
* `b3-single`: Expects or adds Zipkin's B3 single-header tracing headers.
* `w3c`: Expects or adds W3C's traceparent tracing header.
* `preserve`: Does not expect any format, and will transmit whatever header is recognized or present,
with a default of `b3` if none is found. In case of a mismatch between the expected and incoming
tracing headers (for example, when `header_type` is set to `b3` but a w3c-style tracing header is
found in the incoming request), then the plugin will add both kinds of tracing headers
to the request and generate a mismatch warning in the logs.
* `jaeger`: Expects or adds
[Jaeger-style tracing headers](https://www.jaegertracing.io/docs/1.22/client-libraries/#propagation-format) (`uber-trace-id`).
* `ot`: Expects or adds [OpenTelemetry tracing headers](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/96e8523544f04c305da5382854eee06218599075/extensions/trace_propagators/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/extensions/trace/propagation/OtTracerPropagator.java) of the form `ot-tracer-*`.
* `ignore`: Does not read any tracing headers from the incoming request.
Starts a new request using the `default_header_type` value, or falls back to
`b3` if there is no `default_header_type` value set.

zipkin.name: default_header_type
zipkin.description:
Allows specifying the type of header to be added to requests with no pre-existing tracing headers
and when `config.header_type` is set to `"preserve"`.
When `header_type` is set to any other value, `default_header_type` is ignored.

Possible values are `b3`, `b3-single`, `w3c`, `jaeger`, or `ot`.
See the entry for `header_type` for value definitions.

zipkin.name: tags_header
zipkin.description:
The Zipkin plugin will add extra headers to the tags associated with any HTTP
requests that come with a header named as configured by this property. The
format is `name_of_tag=value_of_tag`, separated by semicolons (`;`).

For example: with the default value, a request with the header
`Zipkin-Tags: fg=blue; bg=red` will generate a trace with the tag `fg` with
value `blue`, and another tag called `bg` with value `red`.

zipkin.name: static_tags
zipkin.description:
The tags specified on this property will be added to the generated request traces. For example:
`[ { "name": "color", "value": "red" } ]`.

zipkin.name: http_span_name
zipkin.description:
Specify whether to include the HTTP path in the span name.

Options:
* `method`: Do not include the HTTP path. This is the default.
* `method_path`: Include the HTTP path.

zipkin.name: connect_timeout
zipkin.description: The timeout, in milliseconds, for establishing a connection to the Zipkin server.

zipkin.name: send_timeout
zipkin.description: The timeout, in milliseconds, between two successive write operations when sending a request to the Zipkin server.

zipkin.name: read_timeout
zipkin.description: The timeout, in milliseconds, between two successive read operations when receiving a response from the Zipkin server.

zipkin.name: response_header_for_traceid
zipkin.description:
Set a header name to append to responses. This header name
is sent to the client, making it possible to trace the ID of the
correlated request.

zipkin.name: phase_duration_flavor
zipkin.description:
Specify whether to include the duration of each phase as an annotation or a tag.

Options:
* `annotations`: Include the duration of each phase as an annotation. This is the default.
* `tags`: Include the duration of each phase as a tag.
